id.description: Local ID of the feature (e.g., locally unique on a server)

description.description: A textual description of the feature

uniqueId.description: URI serving as the globally unique identifier of the feature (typically a URN)

label.description: A human readable label for the feature

keywords.description: Short keywords describing the context of this document to aid in discovery.

identifiers.description: Additional identifiers for the asset, useful for discovery (e.g., short name, mission id, model number, serial number, etc.).

label.description: Human readable label for this identifier/classifier

codeSpace.description: URI of codespace defining the possible values for this identifier/classifier

classifiers.description: Classifiers for the asset, useful for discovery (e.g., process type, sensor type, intended application, etc.).

securityConstraints.description: Overall security tagging of process description; Individual tagging of properties can be done using extension properties.

legalConstraints.description: Legal constraints applied to this description (e.g., copyrights, legal use, etc.)

characteristics.description: Groups of characteristics applicable to this asset under various conditions

capabilities.description: Groups of capabilities applicable to this asset under various conditions

contacts.description: The list of contacts related to this asset

description.description: Human readable description of the document

link.description: URI of the document (Favor a URL if the document is directly accessible online)

history.description: The list of events related to this asset

items.description: A time tagged event with description and relevant property values.

identifiers.description: Additional identifiers for the event, useful for discovery.

classifiers.description: Additional classifiers for the event, useful for discovery.

contacts.description: The list of contacts relevant to this event

documentation.description: Additional documentation relevant to this event

properties.description: A list of additional properties of interest to the event (e.g., calibration values, condition category, error codes, etc).

configuration.description: Configuration settings adjusted during the event.

definition.description: Semantic link to the definition of this group of capabilities

conditions.description: The conditions under which the characteristics apply

characteristics.description: The list of characteristics in this group

allOf.description: Base substitution groups for all SWE Common objects with identification metadata
Base substitution groups for all SWE Common objects other than value objects

id.description: The ID of the object, referenceable using a URI fragment

label.description: Human readable label for the object

description.description: Human readable description of the object

definition.description: Semantic link to the definition of this group of capabilities

conditions.description: The conditions under which the capabilities apply

oneOf.description: Scalar component used to express truth: True or False, 0 or 1
Scalar component with integer representation used for a discrete counting value

reason.description: The reason for using the reserved value

oneOf.description: Scalar component with decimal representation and a unit of measure used to store value of a continuous quantity

uom.description: Unit of measure used to express the value of this data component

oneOf.description: Scalar component used to represent a time quantity either as ISO 8601 (e.g., 2004-04-18T12:03:04.6Z) or as a duration relative to a time of reference

referenceTime.description: Specifies the origin of the temporal reference frame as an ISO8601 date (used to specify time after an epoch that is to say in a custom frame)

localFrame.description: Temporal frame of reference whose origin is located by the value of this component

uom.description: Temporal unit of measure used to express the value of this data component

oneOf.description: Scalar component used to represent a categorical value as a simple token identifying a term in a code space

codeSpace.description: Name of the dictionary where the possible values for this component are listed and defined

oneOf.description: Free text component used to store comments or any other type of textual statement
Integer pair used for specifying a count range

referenceFrame.description: Frame of reference (usually temporal or spatial) with respect to which the value of the component is expressed. A reference frame anchors a value to a real world datum.

axisID.description: Specifies the reference axis (refer to CRS axisID). The reference frame URI should also be specified unless it is inherited from parent Vector

nilValues.description: Defines reserved values with special meaning (e.g., missing, out-of-range, etc.)

value.description: Inline value(s) for the component. This property is optional to enable structure to act as a schema for values provided separately (e.g., in a datastream)

reason.description: The reason for using the reserved value

oneOf.description: Decimal pair for specifying a quantity range with a unit of measure

uom.description: Unit of measure used to express the value of this data component

label.description: A human readable label for the unit

symbol.description: The preferred unit symbol to use when presenting the data in a UI (use the UCUM code instead if no symbol is provided)

reason.description: The reason for using the reserved value

oneOf.description: Time value pair for specifying a time range (can be a decimal or ISO 8601)

referenceTime.description: Specifies the origin of the temporal reference frame as an ISO8601 date (used to specify time after an epoch that is to say in a custom frame)

localFrame.description: Temporal frame of reference whose origin is located by the value of this component

uom.description: Temporal unit of measure used to express the value of this data component

reason.description: The reason for using the reserved value

oneOf.description: Pair of categorical values used to specify a range in an ordinal reference system (specified by the code space)

codeSpace.description: Name of the dictionary defining an ordered set of values with respect to which the range is expressed (ordinal reference system)

capabilities.description: The list of capabilities in this group

oneOf.description: Implementation of a mathematical vector composed of a list of scalar coordinates expressed in the mandatory reference frame.

allOf.description: Abstract base class for all data components

updatable.description: Specifies if the value of a data component can be updated externally (i.e., is variable)

optional.description: Specifies if the data for this component can be omitted in the datastream

definition.description: The definition of the property whose value is provided by this component (semantic link)

referenceFrame.description: Frame of reference (usually spatial) with respect to which the coordinates of this vector are expressed. A reference frame anchors a vector value to a real world datum.

localFrame.description: Frame of reference whose origin is located by the coordinates of this vector

coordinates.description: Definition of the coordinate provided as a data component with a numerical representation

oneOf.description: Implementation of ISO-11404 Array datatype. This defines an array of identical data components with a elementCount. Values are given as a block and can be encoded in different ways

elementCount.description: Specifies the size of the array (i.e., the number of elements of the defined type it contains)

value.description: Value is optional, to enable structure to act as a schema for values provided using other encodings

elementType.description: Defines the structure of the element that will be repeated in the array

oneOf.description: Implementation of ISO-11404 Record datatype. This allows grouping (sequence) of data components which can themselves be simple types, records, arrays or choices

fields.description: Definition of the record fields. Fields can be scalars or can themself be aggregates such as records, vectors, arrays, or choices.

oneOf.description: Implementation of a choice of two or more Data Components (also called disjoint union)

choiceValue.description: This category component marks the data stream element that will indicate the actual choice made. Possible choices are listed in the Category constraint section as an enumeration and should map to item names.

items.description: Definition of the choice items. Items can be of any component types

oneOf.title: Geometry
oneOf.description: Implementation of ISO-19107 geometry datatype. This allows embedding a geometry in a larger schema

srs.description: Coordinate reference system with respect to which the coordinates of this geometry are expressed

encoding.description: Specifies the type of method used to encode the array values

oneOf.description: Parameters of the binary encoding method

byteOrder.description: Byte order convention used to encode this binary data (big endian = most significant byte first, MSB or little endian = least significant byte first, LSB)

byteEncoding.description: Byte encoding method used to encode the binary data (raw or base 64)

byteLength.description: Total length in bytes of the binary stream (if known in advance)

members.description: Each member contains detailed parameters for encoding a scalar value or a block of values

oneOf.description: Binary encoding parameters used for encoding a single data component

encryption.description: Name of the encryption method used to encrypt the value of this field

significantBits.description: Number of significant bits actually used for a binary encoded numerical value (all remaining bits shall be set to 0)

byteLength.description: Byte length of this field when a custom data type is used

dataType.description: Binary data type used to encode the value(s) of the referenced data component

ref.description: Reference to the data component that these binary encoding settings apply to

oneOf.description: Binary encoding parameters used to encode a block of values at once. This is used for encrypting or compressing a complete array of values for instance

compression.description: Name of the compression method used to encrypt the block of values described by the referenced data component

encryption.description: Name of the encryption method used to encrypt the block of values described by the referenced data component

paddingBytes-after.description: Number of padding bytes present in the stream after this binary block

paddingBytes-before.description: Number of padding bytes present in the stream before this binary block

byteLength.description: Length in byte of this binary block (if known in advance)

ref.description: Reference to the aggregate data component that this binary block encoding settings apply to

oneOf.description: Parameters of the text encoding method

collapseWhiteSpaces.description: Indicates whether white spaces (i.e., space, tab, CR, LF) should be collapsed with separators when parsing the data stream

decimalSeparator.description: Character used as the decimal separator

tokenSeparator.description: Character sequence used as the token separator (i.e., between two successive values)

blockSeparator.description: Character sequence used as the block separator (i.e., between two successive blocks in the data set. The end of a block is reached once all values from the data tree have been encoded once)

oneOf.description: Parameters of the XML encoding method
Parameters of the JSON encoding method

recordsAsArrays.description: If true, DataRecord values are encoded as JSON arrays instead of JSON objects

vectorsAsArrays.description: If true, Vector values are encoded as JSON arrays instead of JSON objects

values.description: If present, contains an encoded block of the values contained in the array. Values are optional so that the array definition can be used a as a schema for values provided separately

oneOf.description: Implementation of ISO-11404 Array datatype. This defines an array of identical data components with a elementCount. Values are given as a block and can be encoded in different ways

referenceFrame.description: Frame of reference (usually spatial) with respect to which the coordinates of this matrix are expressed

localFrame.description: Frame of reference whose position and orientation are provided by the transformation defined by this matrix

platform.description: The platform that the systems are deployed on

description.description: A textual description of the deployed system

system.description: Link to the system being deployed

configuration.description: The configuration of the system used during this deployment (e.g., sampling rate setting, etc.)

oneOf.description: Defines permitted values for the component, as an enumerated list of tokens or a regular expression pattern
Defines the permitted values for the component as an enumerated list and/or a list of inclusive ranges
Defines the permitted values for the component, as a time range or an enumerated list of time values
